localtag-i18n-welcome: Used to greet the user when reading the i18n/??.json file.
localtag-special-title: Page title of the LocalTag special page.
localtag-special-intro: Wikitext displayed on the LocalTag SpecialPage.
localtag-syntax: The word 'syntax' for use as a column header. (Capitalization encouraged)
localtag-value: The word 'value' for use in documentation. (Lowercase encouraged)
localtag-arg: Recognizable abbreviation of 'argument' for use in documentation. (Lowercase encouraged)
localtag-documentation: The word 'documentation' for use as a column header. (Capitalization encouraged)
localtag-wikitext: The word 'wikitext' for use in documentation. (Lowercase encouraged)
localtag-content: The word 'content' encased in some sort of brackets to distinguish it. (Lowercase encouraged)
localtag-error-require-attributes: An error message saying that <localtag> requires one (or more) attributes to be effective.
localtag-error-attribute-undefined: An error message saying that the attribute given ('foo' in '<localtag foo>') is not defined. Use $1 for the attribute.
localtag-css-for-this: A line that will be added as a comment to the CSS page describing what the code is styling. $1 is the attribute(s) being used. $2 is a PLURAL marker.
localtag-missing-html: A line that will be displayed on the Special:LocalTag page. It says that the defined attribute $1 does not have any HTML associated with it, essentially making it blank and useless.
